79.title: Da Mousa Lisa
79.plot: Wensley Dale has bought a very rare painting online but he can't work out why such an old painting would still be wet. Scratchy instantly recognises the painting, it's the famous Mousa Lisa, but she too is troubled; the Mousa Lisa seems to have developed a frown! Da Easy Crew must find who delivered the picture and work out why the valuable old painting no longer looks like it's supposed to.

80.title: Techno Time
80.plot: Wensley Dale is trying to arrange an important meeting to discuss a new monument for Pow Pow square, but the mice he's invited haven't shown up at the correct time. The President engages the crew to track down the missing mice and get them to the meeting on schedule. But when Da Easy Crew discover that a lot of mice are using Geekamouse's brand new, super-stylish 'Techno' watches they realise that these fancy new 'smart' watches are not that smart after all!

81.title: Da Rollin' Cheese
81.plot: It's the big food festival and Wensley Dale is struggling to finalise all the preparations and hasn't even thought up a name for the event yet. Scratchy and Zoomer volunteer to help transport Bandulu's cheese pies but they fail to show up at the food festival site. Rastamouse must investigate, discovering Scratchy, Zoomer and a crowd of mice pushing and pulling at a broken down truck that's blocking the bridge at Misty Falls. Da Easy Crew must find a super-scientific plan to get all the food to the festival.

82.title: Count on Me
82.plot: Black Whiskers and Lil' Patch are taking the orphans on a special treasure hunt, pirate party but when the orphans and Black Whiskers fail to show up at the 'spot marked X' in time for their picnic, Da Easy Crew must investigate. Rastamouse, Scratchy and Zoomer eventually find Black Whiskers who is convinced that there's a problem with the map but when Rastamouse realises that there's not enough picnic to go around he realises that there's a mouse who's too embarrassed to confess they can't count, multiply, divide or add!

83.title: Dancinderella
83.plot: Lady Uptown is auditioning for a new backing dancer for her stage show. But when the clock strikes noon, the little mouse that has done the best audition disappears leaving behind only a solitary trainer shoe. Da Easy Crew must investigate, chasing all over Mouseland to find the mouse that fits the dancer's shoe!

84.title: Night at the Mouseum
84.plot: Shorty is working as security guard at Da Mouseland Museum. As he works through the night he keeps hearing unusual noises and seeing some mysterious sights! Wensley Dale is concerned and calls upon Da Easy Crew to make a bad ting good and find out 'whaa gwaan'! But will Zoomer discover more than just dust in the old museum?

85.title: Club Cheese
85.plot: Zoomer's distracted by a new computer game called 'Club Cheese' meanwhile Rastamouse is concerned that he hasn't heard from 'the Prez' in quite a while. When Da Easy Crew visit the presidential mansion to check in on Wensley Dale there's no answer, so Rastamouse and his friends must find out 'whaa gwaan'. Da Easy Crew check all the places Wensley is supposed to be but he's not shown up for any of the day's events. However, an encounter with Geekamouse and the sounds emanating from his new tablet computer provide Rastamouse with a crucial clue.

86.title: Da Bagga Bard
86.plot: Spike Cheez is shooting his latest epic movie based on an old play by the most famous Williamouse Da Bard but when Spike discovers the final pages of the play are missing Wensley calls on Da Easy Crew. Rastamouse, Scratchy and Zoomer chase around the island to find a mouse who might remember how the old play ends but no one can remember and the only remaining copy in the library is damaged. Spike's ready to give up on his movie when Rastamouse realises that there's one mouse who has been ignored; a mouse who has an undisclosed passion for words and the works of "Da ...

87.title: Da Special One
87.plot: Jose, a very special kind of coach, is supposed to be taking the President's undefeated volleyball champions through their paces but when the team fail to show up for practice Wensley Dale gets concerned. Da Easy Crew get on the case and check in with the island's volleyball stars but everyone's making excuses about why they can't attend practice. Rastamouse isn't quite sure 'whaa gwaan' until Da Easy Crew volunteer to join the volleyball team. Soon Rastamouse, Scratchy and Zoomer realise that some mouse is being a bit pushy.

88.title: Da Bad Break
88.plot: Frank's hoping to have lots of fun with his new street dance group, the Fresh Style Crew, but no one has shown up for rehearsal. Frank can't work out why and is sad that even his best friend Dexter has given up. Da Easy Crew investigate but all Frank's friends seem a little bit evasive, unable to explain why they can't show up for rehearsal. However, when Rastamouse discovers a clue in the recycling at the Presidential Mansion, Da Easy Crew learn that different dance styles are placing a huge strain on a friendship.

89.title: Da Rollin Stone
89.plot: Chaka Overdub, the world famous reggae star, has arrived at the Presidential Mansion and is receiving the megastar treatment from Gladstone Brie but when he disappears into the garden the President is extremely concerned. Chaka's due on to perform a live gig on For Real FM real soon but no one can find the mouse with his distinctive bright red hair. Time for Da Easy Crew to investigate. As they piece together the clues Rastamouse, Scratchy and Zoomer learn that friendship and conversation are a lot more important than world-fame and fortune!

90.title: Discovery Day
90.plot: Professor Branston's supposed to be organising 'Discovery Day' for da likkle orphans but he hasn't shown up. As the Easy Crew investigate they come across various mice excited by strange goings on in the woods. Could it be Mouseland has a visitor from outer space? Papa might have a clue that could help work out "whaa gwaan?"

91.title: Sugar Gone Sour
91.plot: The President is waiting to hear the brand new track from Da Sugamice but RT, the band's manager, isn't answering Wensley's call. When the Easy Crew investigate they discover the band have broken up and will not play anymore. Scratchy is saddened by the news but can Rastamouse come up with a sweet-talking plan to get the band working together once more.

92.title: Bare Thrills
92.plot: A world famous adventure mouse is coming to Mouseland to film TV special with President Wensley Dale but when Sasha can't find Wensley at the campsite in the woods she summons the Easy Crew to track down her brother. Rastamouse leads the investigation and helps everyone understand that "if there's something out there that gives you a fright, learn the safe way to do things and you'll be alright!"

95.title: Trainin' Day
95.plot: Coach Jose's missing his referees whistle. Dwayne the postmouse has lost his hat and Frank's not having much fun because he's lost his lucky ping pong bat. The Easy Crew investigate but a strange trail of black pebbles prompts further mystery and a concern that the orphan's special surprise trip might have to be cancelled.

96.title: Da Mouseland Cheese Hunt
96.plot: Chocofella has been organising the annual Mouseland Cheese Hunt but the event is about to start and no one can find Chocofella or the list of instructions for the participants. Rastamouse must convince the President that breaking with tradition might be the only way to save the day. Will Wensley Dale go along with Rastamouse's plan or will all the hidden cheese be lost forever!

97.title: Rainin Cheese
97.plot: Zoomer can't believe it - it's raining cheese in Mouseland! Meanwhile, Super's missing a delivery, Natty Kass has lost some hats and the likkle orphans have no tennis balls. Could it be that Carlton's all confused about the recycling or is there a juggled up mystery connected to the Mouseland Got Talent Contest!

99.title: Pump Up Da Volume
99.plot: Mixie believes that some mouse has stolen all the sound to Spike Cheez's latest TV show. Wensley Dale summons the Easy Crew to find the missing sound urgently so that Spike can show off his new movie creation on Mouseland Squeakies, the President's brand new tv-channel for young mice. Puzzled about how the sound has really gone missing Rastamouse comes up with a 'silent' plan and let's the pictures do all the talking!

103.title: School of Rock
103.plot: Bandulu's fretting because the orphans seem to be makin' lots of noise rather than concentrating on their lessons. Wensley Dale has sent them a new highly qualified teacher so he's perplexed about what's going wrong. When the Easy Crew investigate they discover that the new teacher has taken the orphans on a field trip to find heavy rocks and metal but Rastamouse is confused until... a musical clue helps Rastamouse realise that JB, the new teacher, is exploring new ways of learning.

1.title: Da Crucial Plan
1.plot: Da Easy Crew devise a clever plan to discover who has stolen all the cheese in Mouseland.

2.title: Bakin' and Breakin'
2.plot: Rastamouse teaches some tasty dance moves to solve a problem at the orphanage.

3.title: Da Missin' Masterpiece
3.plot: Da Easy Crew must come up with a plan to track down a missing masterpiece.

4.title: For Real FM
4.plot: Da Easy Crew track down a mystery pirate who has taken all the music in mouseland.

5.title: Mice Camera Action
5.plot: Director Spike Cheez arrives in town and makes every mouse go crazy for his new pirate movie.

6.title: Hot Hot Hot
6.plot: Da Easy Crew must arrange a surprise party to track down a very selfish mouse.

7.title: President's Pie
7.plot: A thief has taken a special pie Bandulu, baked for Wensley Dale.

8.title: Wicked Threads
8.plot: Somebody steals Wensley Dale's presidential tie during the island fashion competition.

9.title: Da Marathon Mystery
9.plot: Rastamouse wonders if Rubba is cheating to win the Da Big Cheese Marathon.

10.title: Da Cool Cruiser
10.plot: Rastamouse must apprehend a motorised thief who is determined to win at all costs.

11.title: Da Monstrous Fib
11.plot: Scary sounds have been spooking the orphanage mice during their camping trip.

12.title: Cheesy Rumbles
12.plot: Da Easy Crew investigate strange rumbling sounds in the Buff Bay Caves.

13.title: Boom Bada Boom
13.plot: Rastamouse and Scratchy investigate why everyone in Grove Town is so keen to snooze.

14.title: Da Ice Cold Criminal
14.plot: Rastamouse tracks down a thief with an icy ambition.

15.title: Sole Rebel
15.plot: Zoomer, Rubba and Dub are devastated when their brand new sneakers fall apart.

16.title: Double Crossin' Diva
16.plot: A missing minibus and a talent show trip. Rastamouse must judge who is breaking the rules.

17.title: Toots Re-routes
17.plot: Someone prevents a musical legend from performing at Gladstone Brie's music festival.

18.title: Da Bag a Bling
18.plot: Rastamouse instigates an ingenious plan to catch a person who has borrowed the orphans.

19.title: Pie Without Cheese
19.plot: Wensley Dale's bossy sister Sasha takes over when he goes on vacation.

20.title: Hot Sauce
20.plot: Da Easy Crew have a 'hot' plan to bring about order and save the food festival.

21.title: Lady Uptown
21.plot: Old school music star Lady Uptown is distressed by the disappearance of her lucky brooch.

22.title: Master of Disguise
22.plot: Da Easy Crew comes up with a watertight plan to fix a leaky roof.

23.title: Shorty Shapes Up
23.plot: It is Sports Day and there are 'blingy medals' to be won, but a mouse spoils all the fun.

24.title: Rollin' Ragga Twins
24.plot: The crew stage a roller disco "skatin' competition" in order to trick a copycat thief.

25.title: Sugacube
25.plot: Somebody has stolen an Easy Crew record and is now pretending the music is their own.

26.title: Da Rhymin' Teef
26.plot: Da Easy Crew put aside their music making to track down the President's stolen stereo.

38.title: Kharma
38.plot: Da Easy Crew come up with an open top plan to catch a double decker thief.

39.title: Perfect Pizza
39.plot: Da Easy Crew are helping to put prize winning pizzas on the menu.

40.title: Stumped
40.plot: Da Easy Crew learn that when it comes to cricket, Dwain, the post mouse, is the expert.

41.title: Hot Off Da Press
41.plot: Da Easy Crew investigate the President's missing speech, while a new comic captivates Mouseland with adventures of 'Super Zoomer'.

42.title: Mice Cool Musical
42.plot: Missy D and Scratchy are both coaching the orphans in their musical, but who's going to guarantee that it's a sure-fire smash-hit?

43.title: Zommer Slows Down
43.plot: A thin-crust clue and a familiar tune help Rastamouse and Scratchy get Zoomer ready for the big skate race.

44.title: Mj Meddles
44.plot: There's gonna be a slam dunking basketball contest tonight at Pow Pow Square.

45.title: No Fix Fats
45.plot: Things are breaking down all over Mouseland but Fats is nowhere to be found. Da Easy Crew race to fix everything in time for the 'Summer Party' and find out if Fats is okay.

46.title: Mouse Measles?
46.plot: The 'Great Big Sponsored Skate' is approaching and Da Easy Crew find a way for everyone to participate.

47.title: Rastamouse: Mouse Space Mystery
47.plot: Wensley Dale is planning a special treat for the Little Orphans, but one hi tech thief just might derail his plan.

48.title: Sandy Bad Boyz
48.plot: There are three mice missing and three missing mics. Da Easy Crew must come up with a real smooth plan to find the Sandy Bay Boyz.

49.title: Black Whiskers
49.plot: Wensley calls in Da Easy Crew for a serious problem - the Jammin' Dodger's gone missing.

50.title: Tinie Tinsel
50.plot: While Mouseland waits for some real snow to fall Da Easy Crew must find a mouse whose been distracted by a celebration of lovin' and carin'.

51.title: Da Great Spindiski
51.plot: When President Wensley Dale sits down for breakfast he can't eat a thing - the President's plate's gone missing.

52.title: Natty Hill Carnival
52.plot: Will Rastamouse and Da Easy Crew be able to save Carnival?

1.title: Missing Da Prez
1.plot: The President has promised to deliver the big screen for Spike Cheez's movie premier but Wensley can't be found and his mobile phone has run out of battery. Da Easy Crew follow clues searching for Wensley but instead they find themselves tracking a mouse who is an expert skateboarder, windsurfer and jet ski rider. The clock is ticking and Rastamouse must work out where the President is and where he's trying to get to.

2.title: Da Swinging' Suspect
2.plot: Look like lightnin', Easy Crew. There's a mystery mouse leaving a nutty trail of mayhem in his wake.

3.title: Swap Til Ya Drop
3.plot: Rastamouse comes up with a crafty plan to catch a card cravin' criminal with a passion for collecting.

4.title: Ready Red
4.plot: Da Easy Crew come up with a powerful plan to prove that reading really rocks.

5.title: Rubbish Playground
5.plot: Wensley Dale is trapped inside his mansion unable to do the things that Presidents' do. Da Easy Crew must get out there and stop a messy mouse dumping rubbish all over the island.

6.title: Where Da Hair.
6.plot: Aunt Janessa's lost her best wig, but Da Easy Crew are on the case.

7.title: Da Rare Groove
7.plot: Da Easy Crew follow a wicked beat to help Wensley Dale set a rare groove free.

8.title: S'no Flour
8.plot: The first snow is about to fall in Mouseland, but Da Easy Crew are too busy investigating all the missing flour to join in the fun.

9.title: Message in a Bottle
9.plot: Someone's sending out an S.O.S as the crucial jams of For Real FM fall silent.

10.title: Handmade Music
10.plot: The Little Orphans wake up to find that all their toys are gone.

11.title: Rapper's Block
11.plot: Da Easy Crew must track down Bagga T and help him find his rap.

15.title: Beyond Da Fringe
15.plot: Rastamouse must come up with a chatty plan to keep Ron the barber connected!

16.title: Bad Ting Song
16.plot: Rastamouse, Easy Crew, come in. Come in. Dis is a diff'rent kind ah emergency. Mi havin' an issue wid mi swing so get yaself to da seventh tee.

17.title: Mouseland TV Cribs
17.plot: It's live and it's on your TV. Check out the latest edition of Mouseland TV Cribs and check out some of the coolest homes in the whole of Grovetown.

18.title: Da King's Speech
18.plot: Rastamouse has a perfect performance plan to deal with a serious case of stage fright!

19.title: Da Lost Keys
19.plot: World famous piano virtuoso Oscar Paws is coming to Grovetown to perform a brand new tune, but someone seems determined to disrupt the premier performance.

20.title: Safe
20.plot: Rastamouse must come up with a safe, sound and priceless plan to fix a Mouseland Banking crisis.

21.title: Uptown Feelin' Down
21.plot: Wensley Dale's concerned that Lady Uptown has missed the Orphan's singing lesson. When Da Easy Crew investigate they discover a trail of unusual behaviour as Lady Uptown tries to bling up her car, squeeze her feet into some trendy new trainers and adopt some strange street dance moves into her act. As Rastamouse, Scratchy and Zoomer work out 'whaa gwaan' they also manage to inject some old school magic into Da Grovetown Street Dance Contest.

22.title: Sherlock Homie'
22.plot: There's a new crime bustin' mouse in town, so Wensley's got no qualms about giving Da Easy Crew the day off. But when the substitute investigator fills the Presidential Mansion with a crowd of unlikely suspects Wensley must recall the crew to work out the real mystery, save some mouse reputations and help Carlton give the orphans a big surprise.

23.title: Mousetamind
23.plot: The President's been so busy he hasn't had time to prepare his questions for the big Mouseland Quiz. When Wensley finally has time to 'hit the books' he discovers the mansion bookshelves are bare! Da Easy Crew lend a hand and head to the library where they find all the library books are missing too. Rastamouse must come up with a quiz-tastic plan to catch a clever mouse and the help the President prepare his questions.

24.title: Didier du Rag
24.plot: All the mice in Grovetown are on the look out for a new footie tricks champion but all the footballs in Mouseland are missing.

25.title: Abracada Bredda
25.plot: Only Zoomer's taking notice of Sonny's TV weather forecast. So when Da Easy Crew are called upon to investigate a series of missing objects it's him who works out 'whaa gwaan' first. Hold onto your hats Mouseland as Da Easy Crew come up with a magical plan to help a talented mouse make all the missing items reappear.

26.title: Da Sugamice
26.plot: Scratchy is convinced she's discovered a wicked new girlband to represent Grovetown in this year's battle of the bands. But when Scratchy's band Da Sugamice turn up for rehearsal things don't turn out as she'd planned. Can Scratchy, Rastamouse and Zoomer work out "whaa gwaan" in time ta help Da Sugamice win da competition?

1.title: Eyes Popp
1.plot: "Extra Mozzarella Make It Thick Crust Please...?" Rastamouse is needed to fix the weird lyrics occurring at Mousetival

2.title: Mouserobics
2.plot: Rastamouse needs a fast and upbeat plan to deal with a mystery jam

3.title: Grove Town
3.plot: Will the sun shine on Miss Ruffit as she starts her day in Grove Town?

4.title: Show Band Style
4.plot: Dexter and Da Likkle Orphans are showing bare skills whilst Bandulu and Bagga T have a falling out.

5.title: Chatterbox
5.plot: The Annual Mouseland Choir concert is coming up, and 'the Prez' has an emergency; his Aunt Janessa is supposed to be performing a special number, but she isn't answering her phone.

6.title: Boom Box Bust
6.plot: Easy Crew! Come in! Come in! Ya song got Grovetown movin' and now all dem likkle orphans can get down an' keep on groovin'

7.title: Wicked Wednesday
7.plot: Rastamouse come in! Come In! Dem orphans was havin' a ball but Sasha just decide to take charge an' now she gone off wid dem all!

8.title: Over Da Moon
8.plot: There's a mystery in Mouseland as Bandulu's cheese goes missing, along with a pot of glitter from da Orphanage. Wensley Dale's flat screen TV is no longer where it should be but the Prez has no time to worry - he's gonna be the first mouse in space aboard Professor Branston's new rocket.

9.title: Book Ah Records
9.plot: The new Mouseland Book Ah Records is about to be launched and every mouse is determined to be a record breaker.

10.title: Da Winner Is...
10.plot: It's the Golden Wensley Awards but the awards have all been stolen! Rastamouse and Da Easy Crew follow a golden trail to track down a mouse who's hungry for fame.

11.title: Rappin' Da Spell
11.plot: Wensley Dale is worried that the likkle orphan mice are losing interest in the Mouseland Spelling competition. When Da Easy Crew discover the oprhans sleeping through their dance lesson Rastamouse comes up with a system to turn the orphan into star spellers.

12.title: Dude, Where's Mi Bongo's?
12.plot: Zoomer's been jammin' so much lately he's forgotten where he's left his special bongos and he can't perform without them. Thankfully Rastamouse is on the case proving that best friends will stick together to work out whaa gwaan!

14.title: Chococheese
14.plot: There's a new snack sensation taking Grovetown by storm. All da mice are buying the new Chococheese bars to try and win a golden ticket promising a boom tour of the Chococheese factory!

imdb.plot outline: Rastamouse is a British animated stop motion children's TV series created by Genevieve Webster and Michael De Souza and produced by Three Stones Media/The Rastamouse Company for CBeebies. The show follows crime busting mouse reggae band Da Easy Crew, who split their time between making music and solving mysteries for Da President of Mouseland.
imdb.title: Rastamouse
plot: _Rastamouse_ (qv) is a British animated stop motion children's TV series created by Genevieve Webster and Michael De Souza and produced by Three Stones Media/The _Rastamouse_ (qv) Company for CBeebies. The show follows crime busting mouse reggae band Da Easy Crew, who split their time between making music and solving mysteries for Da President of Mouseland.
